strings: <se_low>Yangus: Uh-oh. I don't like the look of all them wolves in the 'ouse like that. Maybe we're too late...?
<se_high>Jessica: It's okay! The wolves only seem to have got inside the house.
<se_high>Jessica: There doesn't appear to be any sign of a struggle, so I think Marta must be safe somewhere.

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah! I was just about to say that!
We should go an' find her sharpish!

<se_low>Yangus: Oh 'eck! I can't see Marta or Boris nowhere!
Where d'ya reckon they are?

<se_high>Jessica: This is no time for a conversation.
We need to find Marta and make sure she's okay!

<se_def>Angelo: They were probably normal wolves at first,
but now they're under Leopold's control.
<se_def>Angelo: A dog controlling a pack of wolves!? Trust Rhapthorne to have ideas above his station.
<se_low>Yangus: Uh-oh. I don't like the look of all them wolves in the 'ouse like that. Maybe we're too late...?
<se_high>Jessica: It's okay! The wolves only seem to have got inside the house.
<se_high>Jessica: There doesn't appear to be any sign of a struggle, so I think Marta must be safe somewhere.

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah! I was just about to say that!
We should go an' find her sharpish!

<se_low>Yangus: Oh 'eck! I can't see Marta or Boris nowhere!
Where d'ya reckon they are?

<se_high>Jessica: This is no time for a conversation.
We need to find Marta and make sure she's okay!

<se_def>Angelo: They were probably normal wolves at first,
but now they're under Leopold's control.
<se_def>Angelo: A dog controlling a pack of wolves!? Trust Rhapthorne to have ideas above his station.
<se_low>Yangus: I reckon it's a good idea, comin' 'ere before we fight Rhapthorne.
<se_low>Yangus: When I see the burnt-out remains o' Marta's old 'ouse, it makes me all fired up about not bein' able to save 'er! Now I'm ready for a scrap!
<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to believe that we fought a big battle here.

<se_high>Jessica: So many things have happened since then.
It feels like so long ago.
<se_def>Angelo: I can understand you wanting to take a trip down memory lane.<page>Angelo: But maybe saving the world from Rhapthorne should be our first priority at the moment.

<se_def>Angelo: Still, I know how you like your detours.
It's impressive how you still make time for them even when there's an apocalypse in the offing.
<se_low>Yangus: We may 'ave defeated that dog, but I still don't really feel like we got revenge for Marta dyin' like that.
<se_low>Yangus: We should polish off Rhapthorne once an' for all before we go visitin' 'er grave. Make sure we've got somefin' good to tell 'er, like.
<se_high>Jessica: The great sage must have left these monuments because he knew the Lord of Darkness would return one day.<page>Jessica: He created them to warn future generations.
<se_high>Jessica: If you think about it that way, we failed him, because Rhapthorne is back.

<se_high>Jessica: ...But he hasn't conquered the world yet!
If we give it our all, there's still a chance we can stop him!
<se_def>Angelo: Looks like Marek's doing a good job of tending Marta's herb garden.
<se_def>Angelo: It would've been a shame to just let them wither and die after she put so much effort into growing them here.<page>Angelo: It's good that there's someone to take over.
<se_low>Yangus: It must be a bit 'ard for the old woman livin' all the way out 'ere on 'er own, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder why she don't go an' live in that town at the bottom of the mountains she told us about.
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder what kind of relationship Marta and Marek have?
<se_high>Jessica: Since she's the herb expert, I suppose it's like a master and apprentice sort of thing.
<se_def>Angelo: Marta said people have lived here generation after generation guarding these ruins.
<se_def>Angelo: It all sounds a bit like a fairy tale, don't you think? An old woman protecting mysterious ruins in remote, snowy mountains...
<se_def>Angelo: It's a shame the heroine is an old woman rather than a nubile young beauty, though.
<se_low>Yangus: Poor old Marta was one o' them sage 'eirs, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: For 'er sake, we should make sure we get all them orbs an' knock Rhapthorne's block off!
<se_high>Jessica: According to Empyrea, the seven orbs contain the power of the great sages' bloodlines.
<se_high>Jessica: The heirs to the seven sages may have been killed, but their spirits live on inside the orbs.<page>Jessica: That means Alistair and Marta will be fighting right alongside us.
<se_def>Angelo: If you don't know where to find the orbs, you'd be better off using the echo flute than asking me for advice.
<se_def>Angelo: Don't worry. I doubt it'll cause an avalanche. Give it a try.
<se_def>Angelo: If you think about it, we seem to have become Empyrea's lackeys.
<se_def>Angelo: I know we would've had to find a way to defeat Rhapthorne anyway...but I do find this menial labour a bit hard to swallow. Hah!
<se_low>Morrie: I do not see the signora Marta. I pray to the Goddess she is sound and safe...
<se_low>Morrie: I do not see the signora Marta. I pray to the Goddess she is sound and safe...
<se_high>Red: So this is another place where one o' them great sages lived, is it?

<se_high>Red: And now it's just a heap of ash...
That Rhapthorne's a piece o' work, eh?
A real nasty piece o' work.
<se_low>Morrie: The Lord of the Darkness has taken many lives, ay? He makes the shadow over the whole world.
<se_low>Morrie: But we cannot change the past. Now we must think only of how we defeat the Rhapthorne and stop more sad things.
<se_high>Red: Ruins guarded by one o' the great sages, eh? Sounds like a place worth investigatin' for treasure. ...But I ain't really in the mood.
<se_low>Morrie: It is warm here, even with all of the snowing outside. Si, this place makes you feel safe, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Va bene! We must be ruins like these ourselves! We must make the people of the world feel safe again by fighting the Rhapthorne with all of our GUSTO!

<se_low>Morrie: When I was hearing the signora was living
in this place in the mountains by herself,
I was worried.
<se_low>Morrie: But she had so much PASSION! Even alone, she protected what she must protect, ay? Si, she was a sensazione!
